column2: Amgen reacquires rights to three drugs from Glaxo in 48 countries Dec 14 Amgen Inc on Monday said it had reached a deal with British drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline to reacquire the sales rights to three of its products in 48 countries
column3: including Australia as well as markets in Asia

column2: UPDATE 2-Apple Music wins exclusive video deal with Taylor SwiftSamsung appeals Apple patent 'windfall' ruling to U.S. Supreme CourtUPDATE 1-Samsung appeals Apple patent 'windfall' ruling to U.S. Supreme CourtSamsung appeals Apple patent 'windfall' ruling to U.S. Supreme CourtSamsung appeals Apple patent 'windfall' ruling to U.S. Supreme Court NEW YORK Samsung took to the U.S. Supreme Court on Monday in a last-ditch effort to pare back the more than $548 million in damages it must pay Apple for infringing the patents and designs of the iPhone. column2: U.S. Supreme Court rejects human rights suit against OccidentalUPDATE 1-U.S. Supreme Court rejects human rights suit against OccidentalU.S. Supreme Court rejects human rights suit against Occidental WASHINGTON The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday declined to revive a human rights lawsuit against Occidental Petroleum Corp and a security contractor that had accused them of complicity in a deadly 1998 bombing by Colombia's military of a village in the South American country.  U.S. Supreme Court rejects human rights suit against Occidental WASHINGTON The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday declined to revive a human rights lawsuit against Occidental Petroleum Corp and a security contractor that had accused them of complicity in a deadly 1998 bombing by Colombia's military of a village in the South American country. WASHINGTON

column2: Wells Fargo says slump in oil prices could last longer - FT Dec 14 Wells Fargo & Co's head of corporate banking has warned of stresses in the bank's energy portfolio and said the slump in oil prices "feels deeper and broader and could last longer"
column3: the Financial Times reported on Monday.

column2: Shareholder names former Yahoo execs among potential Mayer replacements Dec 14 An outspoken Yahoo Inc  shareholder said on Monday he considers former Yahoo executives Ross Levinsohn and Jacqueline Reses as potential replacements for Chief Executive Officer Marissa Mayer as the internet company comes under pressure to change strategic direction.
US hogs fed pig remains
column3: manure to fend off deadly virus return Dec 14 Animal-nutritionist John Goihl knows Minnesota farmers who feed the remains of dead baby pigs to hogs used for breeding in attempts to ward off infections of a deadly virus in offspring.
